article_title: Brian Herr pulls papers for Hopkinton selectman
article_text:
During his Senate race, Herr ran on a platform of growing the economy, creating jobs, repealing Obamacare, restoring fiscal responsibility and setting term limits.

Herr said he entered the race because he was frustrated with what he was seeing in Washington, D.C., including Markey's foreign policy votes and a lack of response to trying to grow the economy.

article_metadata.description: HOPKINTON — Brian Herr, a Republican who ran unsuccessfully for U.S. Senate, has pulled nomination papers to possibly return to the Board of Selectmen. Herr did not seek re-election for selectman last year so he could wage his campaign to unseat U.S. Senator Ed Markey. Herr had served two terms on the board before seeking higher office."It is very likely I will run," Herr said Friday afternoon. "I enjoy the job and appreciate working on behalf of the community."Herr said he
article_metadata.author: Jonathan Phelps Daily News Staff

article_summary:
During his Senate race, Herr ran on a platform of growing the economy, creating jobs, repealing Obamacare, restoring fiscal responsibility and setting term limits.
Herr said he entered the race because he was frustrated with what he was seeing in Washington, D.C., including Markey's foreign policy votes and a lack of response to trying to grow the economy.
